result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ray Latrel Bradley in court.  
Attorney Taylor Haefele for Allison Marie Ritter in court for Ray Latrel Bradley.  
Attorney Brittany Skye Kachingwe in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Plea Hearing.
Stand in counsel advises the court Attorney Ritter need time to complete plea documents with client and request an adjournment
Parties agreed to have next hearing placed on Judge Franke Calendar for a speedy disposition. 
Court ordered matter adjourned for a plea and sentencing before Judge Franke.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Court ordered case transferred to Branch 19 to resolve with defendant felony case ( 22CF908) globally.

Court is in receipt of defense counsel's motion to adjourn status conference date.  Court grants adjournment request.  Parties emailed new court date.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defense's Motion to Adjourn Scheduling Conference
Order for Court Appointed PI, signed and filed.

Defendant Ray Latrel Bradley in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with L.M.W.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ray Latrel Bradley in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Pretrial Conference.
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
